_header: Though that the wolf hore hood as priest [Þey þou þe vulf hore hod to preste]
_description: Three alliterative lines in a Latin exemplum ‘De Isengrino monacho’, in fable 22 of Odo of Cheriton’s Liber parabolarum

BodDou88.Transcription:
Þath þu þe uulf hore hodi to prestesete him to
                    leþ and psalmes lereeuere bethe his geres to þe wode
                    uuard
BodDou88.Editions:
Breeze,  Andrew. 
             “New Texts of Index of Middle English Verse 3513.” 
             Medium Ævum
         61 (1992): 284-7: 285.

BodDou169.Transcription:
Iff alle þat þe worlf vnto þe prest wortheand be sette
                    onto boke salmes to lereȝit is eure hys oune eye to þe
                    wodeward
BodDou169.Editions:
Breeze,  Andrew. 
             “New Texts of Index of Middle English Verse 3513.” 
             Medium Ævum
         61 (1992): 284-7: 285.

CamCCC441.Transcription:
Þai þu Wlf hore hodi te presteþo þu hym sette
                    salmes to lereeuere beth his geres to þe groueward
CamCCC441.Note:
Preceded by Latin ‘Yseingrinus semel….uoluit esse
                        monachus…’, which it translates.
CamCCC441.Editions:
Wright,  Thomas.

XBrown,  Carleton Fairchild. 
             English Lyrics of the XIIIth Century.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1932.” 
             Speculum
         9 (1934): 219-25: 219, n. 2.
Breeze,  Andrew. 
             “New Texts of Index of Middle English Verse 3513.” 
             Medium Ævum
         61 (1992): 284-7: 285.

CamCCC481.Transcription:
Þah þu þe wolf hore hodi to presteSete him to boke and
                    psalmes him lerenaure bieþ his geres to þe wode ward
CamCCC481.Editions:
Breeze,  Andrew. 
             “New Texts of Index of Middle English Verse 3513.” 
             Medium Ævum
         61 (1992): 284-7: 285.

BLHar219.Transcription:
If al that the wolf vn to a preest worthe and be set vn to
                    bookpsalmes to leere yit his eye is euere to the wodeward
BLHar219.Note:
Written as prose (and here lacking rhyme or meter), introduced by
                        ‘Vnde solet anglice dici’ (f.
                    5v).

Breeze,  Andrew.

             Medium Ævum

BLAdd11579.Transcription:
þey þou þe vulf hoþe hod to presteþey
                    þou him to skole sette salmes to lerneHeuer bet hise geres to þe
                    groue grene

BLRoy7Ci.Transcription:
Þey meo þe wolf hore hodi to prestand him to boke sete
                    salmes to lerenher beuth is eyen atte vodes hent
BLRoy7Ci.Editions:
Breeze,  Andrew. 
             “New Texts of Index of Middle English Verse 3513.” 
             Medium Ævum
         61 (1992): 284-7: 285.

NLWLan4.Transcription:
Þey þo þan wold hor wwlff hode to presteuer buth hes
                    wiles att þe wode es enide
NLWLan4.Note:
In the course of a translation of the Liber into
                    Welsh.
NLWLan4.Editions:
Breeze,  Andrew. 
             “New Texts of Index of Middle English Verse 3513.” 
             Medium Ævum
         61 (1992): 284-7: 285.

ArrBM184.Transcription:
Lat ye deulf hore hodi to prestesecce to boke an psalmes to
                    lerenevez lokys hus geres to ye wodewar
ArrBM184.Note:
In the course of a translation of the Liber into
                    French.
ArrBM184.Editions:
Breeze,  Andrew. 
             “New Texts of Index of Middle English Verse 3513.” 
             Medium Ævum
         61 (1992): 284-7: 285.

BerlinPhill.Transcription:
Þath þu þe wulf hore hodi to prestesette him to
                    leþ and salmes lereevre beth his geres to þe groveward
BerlinPhill.Editions:
Breeze,  Andrew. 
             “New Texts of Index of Middle English Verse 3513.” 
             Medium Ævum
         61 (1992): 284-7: 285.
